example.text: Our nation is in the midst of a surge of illegal immigration as a result of the administration's attempt to end the Title 42 public health order. Title 42 grants our Border Patrol and US Customs the authority to expel immigrants to their country of last transit who pose a health risk, either by virtue of being subject to previously announced travel restrictions or because they unlawfully entered the country to bypass health screening measures.

Read my press release Reintroducing my Finding Federal Savings bill I was proud to reintroduce my Finding Federal Savings Committee Resolution, which would help get federal spending under control and reduce the federal deficit. The Finding Federal Savings Committee Resolution would create a bipartisan committee in the House dedicated to finding and reforming underperforming and non-essential federal programs, helping to put our fiscal house in order.

I was proud to recognize 232 individuals and organizations with certificates in acknowledgement of their total 27,625.5 volunteer hours at [[user]]! These volunteers are critical to improving live for our servicemembers and their families stationed at Fort Irwin NTC, and it… [[url]] [[url]]

HR 4772 aims to correct outdated policies that continue to complicate veterans' ability to secure adequate compensation when using prosthetics and other medical devices by requiring the VA to continue the clothing allowance for veterans who wear a prosthetic, use an orthopedic appliance (e.g., a wheelchair), or use a prescription skin medication that the VA determines causes irreparable damage to clothing. I was proud to support this common-sense solution for our vets.

The chief responsibility and original mandate of the federal government is to guarantee our national security and ensure the readiness of our armed forces in their confrontation with emerging and increasingly hostile threats to American security. I am committed to supporting our military servicemembers and veterans and enhancing the security of our country.

HR 4772 aims to correct outdated policies that continue to complicate veterans' ability to secure adequate compensation when using prosthetics and other medical devices by requiring the VA to continue the clothing allowance for veterans who wear a prosthetic, use an orthopedic appliance (e.g., a wheelchair), or use a prescription skin medication that the VA determines causes irreparable damage to clothing. I was proud to support this common-sense solution for our vets.
